ACA.target: 18+ without Medicare, Medicaid, or employer insurance

scriptTemplate.opening: Hi [FIRST NAME] [LAST NAME]. It's [YOUR NAME] from America's Health on a recorded line, just calling about the FREE HEALTH GOVERNMENT SUBSIDY through the Affordable Care Act! Have you received that yet?
scriptTemplate.mmwCheck: Ok not a problem, so it's just for folks who do not have Medicare or Medicaid or work insurance... you don't have any of those correct?
scriptTemplate.mmwDoubleCheck: And just to be sure, you do not have either Medicare, or Medicaid or work insurance?
scriptTemplate.preTransfer: OK THAT'S EVERYTHING I NEED FROM YOU. I will now get someone on the line to see what kind of health insurance subsidy you MAY qualify for.
scriptTemplate.consentRequired: CUSTOMER MUST SAY 'OK' FOR YOU TO TRANSFER

keyPhrases.phrase: Medicare or Medicaid or work insurance

checklist.name: Confirm Client Name
checklist.description: Confirm client's first AND last name
mustInclude: last name or full name mentioned

checklist.name: Agent Introduction
checklist.description: Introduce yourself (agent name)

checklist.name: Company Name Stated
checklist.description: Mention company name (America's Health / Benefit Link / Health Benefit Guide)

checklist.name: Recorded Line Disclosure
checklist.description: Mention 'recorded line'

checklist.name: FREE Health Subsidy/ACA Mention
checklist.description: Mention 'FREE Health Government Subsidy through the Affordable Care Act'
mustInclude: subsidy OR affordable care act OR ACA

checklist.name: No M/M/W Check (First)
checklist.description: Confirm NO Medicare, Medicaid, or Work Insurance (FIRST TIME)

checklist.name: State Confirmation
checklist.description: Confirm state

checklist.name: No M/M/W Check (Second/Double Confirm)
checklist.description: Double confirm NO Medicare, Medicaid, or Work Insurance (SECOND TIME)
checklist.notes: Must be AFTER the first M/M/W check - look for second occurrence

checklist.name: Verbal Consent to Transfer
checklist.description: Get verbal consent to transfer (customer MUST say 'okay')
checklist.notes: Customer MUST verbally agree before transfer

checklist.name: Cold Transfer Execution
checklist.description: Cold transfer: Do NOT introduce the customer - just wait for them to greet each other, then hang up
checklist.notes: Should NOT introduce customer to LA - cold transfer only

MEDICARE.target: 65+ with Medicare Part A AND Part B

scriptTemplate.opening: Hey, good morning [CUSTOMER NAME]? Hey [CUSTOMER NAME], this is [YOUR NAME], I'm with America's Health on a recorded line. We were just giving you a quick call today about your food and utility card that you never received.
scriptTemplate.medicareCheck: Now that card, it IS exclusively for members who have Medicare Parts A and B. You DO still have your Medicare Parts A and B, correct?
scriptTemplate.rwbConfirm: Okay, perfect and JUST to double confirm, that IS the red, white, and blue card, correct?
scriptTemplate.rwbFallback: You don't have the physical card, but you DO still have Parts A and B, correct?
scriptTemplate.foodBenefits: Perfect, thanks for confirming. So yeah, it DOES look like you may be ENTITLED to some additional food benefits since food prices have gone up.
scriptTemplate.stateZipConfirm: Now if that's sent, I DO still have you out in [STATE], with the zip code [ZIP], correct?
scriptTemplate.preTransfer: Perfect, well that is EVERYTHING I need. So, a Medicare specialist is coming on the line now to review the additional food benefits FOR you. Give them JUST a few minutes to go over them with you, okay?
scriptTemplate.transferExplanation: Alright so you'll hear a little bit of ringing, that's just me connecting them in and once they pick up they'll ask you for your name, okay?

keyPhrases.phrase: hear a little bit of ringing

branchingLogic.medicareNo: There must have been a mistake. Thank you for your time. [CODE AS DQ]
branchingLogic.medicareDontKnow: Do you have the red, white and blue card? If yes: So you DO have Parts A and B, right?
branchingLogic.rwbNo: You don't have the physical card, but you DO still have Parts A and B, correct?

checklist.name: Confirm Client Name
checklist.description: Confirm client's first AND last name

checklist.name: Agent Introduction
checklist.description: Introduce yourself (agent name)

checklist.name: Company Name Stated
checklist.description: Mention company name: America's Health

checklist.name: Recorded Line Disclosure
checklist.description: Mention 'recorded line'

checklist.name: Food/Utility Card Mention
checklist.description: Mention the Food and Utility card they never received

checklist.name: Medicare Part A & B Verification
checklist.description: Confirm Medicare Part A AND Part B (must have BOTH)

checklist.name: Red, White, Blue Card Question
checklist.description: Ask the red, white, and blue card question (double confirmation)
checklist.notes: This is the Medicare card - confirms they have original Medicare

checklist.name: State AND Zip Code Confirmation
checklist.description: Confirm state AND zip code
mustInclude: state AND zip code both mentioned

checklist.name: Additional Food Benefits Mention
checklist.description: Mention additional food benefits due to rising food prices

checklist.name: Verbal Consent to Transfer
checklist.description: Get verbal consent ('okay') - customer must affirm before transfer
detectionPatterns: go over them with you, okay

checklist.name: Cold Transfer Explanation
checklist.description: Tell customer specialist is coming on, they'll hear ringing, agent will ask for name
detectionPatterns: hear a little bit of ringing
they'll ask you for your name

WHATIF.notes: WHATIF campaign follows Medicare compliance rules

autoFailViolations.name: Making Promises
autoFailViolations.description: Do not imply eligibility, qualification, or benefits
autoFailViolations.notes: Must use conditional language (MAY, MIGHT) not definitive language

autoFailViolations.name: Discussing Money
autoFailViolations.description: Do not mention income, expenses, payments, or financial benefits

autoFailViolations.name: Discussing Politics/Religion
autoFailViolations.description: Avoid topics like government, presidents, or faith

autoFailViolations.name: Incorrect Transfers
autoFailViolations.description: Do not transfer gatekeepers or non-English speakers without verified POA and the prospect present
autoFailViolations.notes: Must verify POA before transferring someone speaking for the prospect

autoFailViolations.name: Wrong Disposition/Miscoding
autoFailViolations.description: Do not code incorrectly (e.g., AM as transfer)

autoFailViolations.name: No-Response Transfer
autoFailViolations.description: Do not proceed or transfer without prospect responses
autoFailViolations.notes: Customer must be actively engaged throughout call

autoFailViolations.name: Ignoring DNC Requests
autoFailViolations.description: If prospect asks to be Do-Not-Called, end call immediately
autoFailViolations.notes: Call must end immediately after DNC request

autoFailViolations.name: Transferring Disqualified Prospects
autoFailViolations.description: Do not transfer prospects who are ineligible

autoFailViolations.name: Misrepresenting Affiliation
autoFailViolations.description: Do not claim partnership with specific insurance companies

autoFailViolations.name: Incorrect Insurance Messaging
autoFailViolations.description: Never state: 'This call is not about insurance', 'You will not change your insurance', etc.
autoFailViolations.notes: These statements are misleading - the call IS related to health coverage

autoFailViolations.name: Poor Call Quality
autoFailViolations.description: Do not transfer if call audio is unclear or breaking up
autoFailViolations.notes: May require manual review - transcript quality indicates audio quality

autoFailViolations.name: Poor Prospect State
autoFailViolations.description: Do not proceed if prospect is busy, distracted, angry, or shouting
autoFailViolations.notes: Agent should not proceed with hostile or unavailable prospects

absolutelyBanned.reason: Never use company name with prospects

contextuallyBanned.context: When discussing what prospect will receive
When discussing what prospect will receive
When discussing what prospect will receive
When discussing what prospect will receive

doNotTransfer: Low-intent clients showing no genuine interest
Anyone who mentions being on the DNC list
Anyone busy, distracted, or not in the right frame of mind
Answering machines - no response means no transfer

criticalDistinction.SSI: Supplemental Security Income - CAN proceed if no other coverage
criticalDistinction.SSDI: Social Security Disability Insurance - CANNOT proceed, always DQ

canProceed: Has Medicare Part A AND Part B

dispositionCodes.name: Dead Air
dispositionCodes.description: No response / Hangs up before responding

goldenSafetyPhrase: That's a great question for the licensed agent. I don't want to mislead you, so let me get you connected, okay?

scriptAdherence.description: Real script adherence scoring based on comparison to canonical script templates

keyPhraseMatching.description: Percentage of required key phrases found in transcript

sequenceOrder.description: Whether key phrases appear in correct order

customerResponseHandling.description: Proper handling of customer responses and branching logic

scoring.high: All expected responses received and handled correctly

terminologyCompliance.description: Use of approved terminology, avoidance of banned phrases

scoring.high: No banned phrases, all approved terminology
scoring.low: Banned phrases detected or critical terminology missing
